body:
## Hello everyone! 

There have been many changes recently to the ruqqus code base and we hope this has improved your browsing experience.

That being said, we are aware of some current issues that have been reported such as :

- comment context causing 500 error
- issues with user blocking

Please use this thread to provide a (detailed) description for any and all bugs found.


Thanks,
ruqqus team
body_html:
Hello everyone!

There have been many changes recently to the ruqqus code base and we hope this has improved your browsing experience.

  • issues with user blocking

Please use this thread to provide a (detailed) description for any and all bugs found.

Thanks, ruqqus team
title: Report Bugs

body:
I'm on mobile so I can't link it, but go to the Ruqqus help page, and look at the Formatting section.  When it talks about how to embed an image in a comment,  there's a footnote that says that there is a whitelist of websites from which you can embed images.

 If you click on the "whitelist" hyperlink, the page it links to is broken.
body_html:
I'm on mobile so I can't link it, but go to the Ruqqus help page, and look at the Formatting section. When it talks about how to embed an image in a comment, there's a footnote that says that there is a whitelist of websites from which you can embed images.

If you click on the "whitelist" hyperlink, the page it links to is broken.

body:
Edit: The app is unofficial, I'll post these on their github. Nvm! 

This may be low priority, because this appears to be confined to the Android app. But upon trying to open images they are [not displaying correctly](https://i.imgur.com/aRxfzu5.png). They appear to be off-center with an origin from the top-left, you would have to scroll down and to the right to view the image. It also doesn't scale the view appropriately to your screen.

When bringing up the copy/paste options on Android it seems to cut off half the window, for me anyway. 

Sometimes, when trying to comment on Android, it also doesn't give you the option to actually submit. The text box remains like you never started typing. 

I'll keep my eye out for others
body_html:
Edit: The app is unofficial, I'll post these on their github. Nvm!

This may be low priority, because this appears to be confined to the Android app. But upon trying to open images they are not displaying correctly. They appear to be off-center with an origin from the top-left, you would have to scroll down and to the right to view the image. It also doesn't scale the view appropriately to your screen.

When bringing up the copy/paste options on Android it seems to cut off half the window, for me anyway.

Sometimes, when trying to comment on Android, it also doesn't give you the option to actually submit. The text box remains like you never started typing.

I'll keep my eye out for others

body: I noticed that you receive Error 500 for trying to access comment contexts from your inbox. In fact, it actually doesn't even need to be your inbox. You try to context any comment from anywhere, it gives Error 500. So one problem that comes out of this is that large comment chains are now inaccessible because the site breaks whenever you click on 'Show more comments' and it loads the page to go to the comment contexts. Because of this, you cannot continue a discussion.
body_html: I noticed that you receive Error 500 for trying to access comment contexts from your inbox. In fact, it actually doesn't even need to be your inbox. You try to context any comment from anywhere, it gives Error 500. So one problem that comes out of this is that large comment chains are now inaccessible because the site breaks whenever you click on 'Show more comments' and it loads the page to go to the comment contexts. Because of this, you cannot continue a discussion.

body:
I have another trivial thing to report.

I also noticed that all it takes to get a 404 is to add a slash or / in front of any working Ruqqus link.

Like, if an user is named abc, then the link to their profile would be https://ruqqus.com/@abc

But if you add a / in front of that link to get https://ruqqus.com/@abc/, Ruqqus gives a 404 (while most websites that I've used don't really care about the /)

Why does the site screw up just because of a '/' ?

body:
If you are using the mobile site, if you are scrolled to the bottom of a feed and can see "Back/Next", it will be blocked by the footer if you view the comments on a post, and press the back button.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Go to any feed (New, Hot, etc)
2. Scroll to the bottom of the feed
3. View a comment section
4. Press the back button

If you scroll up slightly, I believe the footer will hide, but from a UI/UX perspective the user shouldn't need to do that.

[Picture of the bug happening](https://i.imgur.com/P9qGNh4.jpg)
body_html:
If you are using the mobile site, if you are scrolled to the bottom of a feed and can see "Back/Next", it will be blocked by the footer if you view the comments on a post, and press the back button.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Go to any feed (New, Hot, etc)
  2. Scroll to the bottom of the feed
  3. View a comment section
  4. Press the back button

If you scroll up slightly, I believe the footer will hide, but from a UI/UX perspective the user shouldn't need to do that.

Picture of the bug happening

body:
+Private is a private guild. In the guild settings, it says "You will also be unable to yank posts from +general into +Private, unless the post was originally made in +Private". However, I was still able to yank [a post](https://ruqqus.com/post/s83/just-another-post) from +general into +private. The post itself stays public.

***

When click on an [embedded from i.ruqqus.com](https://ruqqus.com/post/h8e/embedding-images-from-iruqquscom), and click on "go to website", the link goes to "[undefined](undefined)".

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/post/67x/EaNkUiAv7UQ)

***

Very minor issue, but if you edit a comment, it says "comment posted".

***

(Most of these are minor issues)

>In quotes, [links](# "you found it") have the same color as the body text
body_html:
+Private is a private guild. In the guild settings, it says "You will also be unable to yank posts from +general into +Private, unless the post was originally made in +Private". However, I was still able to yank a post from +general into +Private. The post itself stays public.

When click on an embedded from i.ruqqus.com, and click on "go to website", the link goes to "undefined".

Very minor issue, but if you edit a comment, it says "comment posted".

(Most of these are minor issues)

In quotes, links have the same color as the body text

There have been many changes recently to the ruqqus code base and we hope this has improved your browsing experience.

That being said, we are aware of some current issues that have been reported such as :

  • comment context causing 500 error
  • issues with user blocking

Please use this thread to provide a (detailed) description for any and all bugs found.

Thanks, ruqqus team

body:
I'm not sure how to classify this: 

If you comment on a post and then block the OP, you can still view the post in your comments despite it disappearing from +all and other such feeds. If you try and access it, it throws a 503 Application Error rather than a message saying "You're trying to view a post by a person you have blocked" or some other type of service-to-user message saying what you're doing doesn't work because you have this person blocked.
body_html:
I'm not sure how to classify this:

If you comment on a post and then block the OP, you can still view the post in your comments despite it disappearing from +All and other such feeds. If you try and access it, it throws a 503 Application Error rather than a message saying "You're trying to view a post by a person you have blocked" or some other type of service-to-user message saying what you're doing doesn't work because you have this person blocked.

body:
Minor issue: When a page redirects to change in capitalization, the URL parameters are stripped off.

Examples: 

* https://ruqqus.com/+watchredditdie?sort=new redirects to https://ruqqus.com/+WatchRedditDie, not https://ruqqus.com/+WatchRedditDie?sort=new
* https://ruqqus.com/@SFROHNE/comments?page=2 redirects to https://ruqqus.com/@sfrohne/comments, not https://ruqqus.com/@sfrohne/comments?page=2

Edit: ^ Urls and links with user mentions act strangely v

`[I am a link, hover over me, https://ruqqus.com/@SFROHNE/comments?page=2, I am a link](https://ruqqus.com/@SFROHNE/comments?page=2 "Title")`

[I am a link, hover over me, https://ruqqus.com/@SFROHNE/comments?page=2, I am a link](https://ruqqus.com/@SFROHNE/comments?page=2 "Title")

`[I am a link, hover over me, @sfrohne, I am a link](https://ruqqus.com/@SFROHNE/comments?page=2 "Title")`

[I am a link, hover over me, @sfrohne, I am a link](https://ruqqus.com/@SFROHNE/comments?page=2 "Title")

Same issue with links to guilds

`[I am a link, hover over me, +WatchRuqqusDie, I am a link](/whatever "Title")`

[I am a link, hover over me, +WatchRuqqusDie, I am a link](/whatever "Title")

Also, I got a notification by tagging myself. Not sure if that's intended or not.
body_html:
Minor issue: When a page redirects to change in capitalization, the URL parameters are stripped off.

Examples:

  • https://ruqqus.com/+watchredditdie?sort=new redirects to https://ruqqus.com/+WatchRedditDie, not https://ruqqus.com/+WatchRedditDie?sort=new
  • https://ruqqus.com/@sfrohne/comments?page=2 redirects to https://ruqqus.com/@sfrohne/comments, not https://ruqqus.com/@sfrohne/comments?page=2

Edit: ^ Urls and links with user mentions act strangely v

[I am a link, hover over me, https://ruqqus.com/@SFROHNE/comments?page=2, I am a link](https://ruqqus.com/@SFROHNE/comments?page=2 "Title")

I am a link, hover over me, https://ruqqus.com/@sfrohne/comments?page=2, I am a link

[I am a link, hover over me, @sfrohne, I am a link](https://ruqqus.com/@SFROHNE/comments?page=2 "Title")

I am a link, hover over me, @sfrohne, I am a link

Same issue with links to guilds

[I am a link, hover over me, +WatchRuqqusDie, I am a link](/whatever "Title")

I am a link, hover over me, +WatchRuqqusDie, I am a link

Also, I got a notification by tagging myself. Not sure if that's intended or not.

body:
So if you highlight something to try to Italicize it after you have already Bolded it, and you accidentally highlight the little double stars on both sides of the section you are trying to Italicize then hit the button. It will result in the Bold stars disappearing and the rest of what was written to be deleted. It literally deleted a whole paragraph on me for me to discover this. However doing the same thing in reverse works fine....   Also you can seemingly endlessly keep adding little italicize stars on the sides if you highlight only the inner words, after testing it, I don't this this has any actual effect.  ****************Test spot.****************

Suddenly I find myself curious what happens if I copy paste those stars too...
****************
****************
****************
****************
****************
****************
****************
****************
****************

body:
You can't view the upvote/downvote counts of deleted posts. Examples: [Post 1](https://ruqqus.com/post/1mji/hate-speech-laws-true-purpose), [Post 2](https://ruqqus.com/post/s7n/uqqus-might-already-have-a-power)

[Deleted posts aren't shown as deleted in post previews](https://ruqqus.com/post/1ojx/hate-speech-laws-true-purpose)

I'm not sure if this is intentional, but you can't vote on deleted posts, and if a deleted post is a link post, you can't visit the link by clicking the title.
body_html:
You can't view the upvote/downvote counts of deleted posts. Examples: Post 1, Post 2

Deleted posts aren't shown as deleted in post previews

I'm not sure if this is intentional, but you can't vote on deleted posts, and if a deleted post is a link post, you can't visit the link by clicking the title.

body:
If @User has private mode on and is a deleted account, then going to @User/comments doesn't show the "account deleted" page.

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/c2f6233436e13b3893d15d506ef90a667cbbe6f2/ruqqus/routes/users.py#L167 (Checks if is private before checking if is deleted)

Examples: [@Based_FFXIV_Jannie](https://ruqqus.com/@Based_FFXIV_Jannie/comments), [@Total](https://ruqqus.com/@Total/comments), [@TheBreadMan](https://ruqqus.com/@TheBreadMan/comments)

\^Also, user mentions still seem to break links

[@sfrohne](#a) | [@sfrohne is](#a) | [Link](#a) | [Text begins @sfrohne Text ends](#a) |

    [@sfrohne](#a) | [@sfrohne is](#a) | [Link](#a) | [Text begins @sfrohne Text ends](#a) |

body:
Invalid color codes in guilds

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/4b9ec0daccff95018f30fa42683c5538ab51133c/ruqqus/routes/boards.py#L1032

It only checks the first, third, and fifth characters of the color code you enter. I typed in the code "2-3-4-", which is an invalid color code, and now my guild looks like this:

https://web.archive.org/web/20200930010700/https://ruqqus.com/+SomeGuild

Edit: should also make sure the numbers aren't negative so "-2-3-4" wouldn't work

body:
Of course *I* made that. See how I'm the only one who ever misses stuff this obvious? Everyone else catches it immediately but it always flies over my head the whole damn time. I don't just make mistakes, I *am* a mistake.

I can't even see my own bugs, or find any by experimenting, let alone actually finding bugs by purposely looking through the code. And even less so finding an insane bug like the underscore one, and I'd *NEVER **EVER*** figure out the cause of something like that, I could rip my hair out for years looking for a solution, but you figured out it was an SQL wildcard character in like 2 seconds. And you said you're not even a programmer, yet I am. So yeah, there's clearly no hope for me.
body_html:

body:
I knew of a bug that let you view the username of a deleted account from a comment by looking at the HTML (And I never reported it because I got lazy, but it's still there, and you can report it if you want. I think it might be in [this line](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/c940fdea633a4a202dda8482f11583a80f9ee940/ruqqus/templates/comments.html#L86) or something, where they don't check to see if the account is deleted when adding the profile pictures), so I went to some old threads with a lot of comments and looked for some usernames.

I looked at the /comments page just because I was curious.

body:
> I don't know of anyone else who has noted it

Because no one but the two of us cares about this stuff.

> Aren't bugs sometimes just hard to find/fix?

Obviously not, since you find every single one, even from just looking at code where it's not even apparent.

> I think there's a reason why they sometimes joke about spending hours just to find an "obvious bug"

I've never heard that joke before. But if it exists perhaps it's more because other people usually think of all the bugs the first time so they don't have any in the first place. That's definitely what I've observed.

> It's definitely not a problem that's unique to you.

If we restrict it to those with any experience in this area whatsoever it is. I don't know of one other person who even dabbles in programming that has this problem.

I have an extremely low ceiling for my ability in every single area, even the most arbitrary things like this. "Practice makes perfect" and "10,000 hours" is a myth, it just fine-tunes what you can already do. I'll probably never be cut out for anything no matter how hard I strive for it, while everyone else is having a blast doing all sorts of crazy stuff. I don't know how I'm supposed to be okay with that. People always give me the "don't compare yourself" disney talks, but it doesn't change the fact that I can't even enjoy one hobby.

parent.body:
If @User has private mode on and is a deleted account, then going to @User/comments doesn't show the "account deleted" page.

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/c2f6233436e13b3893d15d506ef90a667cbbe6f2/ruqqus/routes/users.py#L167 (Checks if is private before checking if is deleted)

Examples: [@Based_FFXIV_Jannie](https://ruqqus.com/@Based_FFXIV_Jannie/comments), [@Total](https://ruqqus.com/@Total/comments), [@TheBreadMan](https://ruqqus.com/@TheBreadMan/comments)

\^Also, user mentions still seem to break links

[@sfrohne](#a) | [@sfrohne is](#a) | [Link](#a) | [Text begins @sfrohne Text ends](#a) |

    [@sfrohne](#a) | [@sfrohne is](#a) | [Link](#a) | [Text begins @sfrohne Text ends](#a) |
